(cont'd)

"... The role of ideology is to suppress these in the interests of dominant groups. Consequently, reality construction occurs on 'sites of struggle'. As John Hartley comments, 'contending social forces seek to 'fix' the meaning-potential of each sign with an evaluative accent conducive to their particular interests' and at the same time try to present evaluative differences as differences in fact."

- Daniel Chandler, Semiotics for Beginners
